item.title: Report X-2023061277
item.description:
Report X-2023061277

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found damaged on trailer. Package looked to have fallen along with other packages during transport due to inadequate trailer loading/ building. Package was found on its side and had liquid stains on top and side of box. The pail inside box contains traces of the liquid on and around container. Package was isolated and put in a hazardous bin. DescribePack: The cap at the top of the container let out some of the liquid due to package not being sat up right and pressure from the liquid being put on the cap. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was sat up right and put into a hazardous bin.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Top of package was wet and had a gasoline type odor. Found in unload during presort DescribePack: The rim of the metal can was dented from impact during transit casuing small amounts to leak at the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was removed from the unload and placed into a hazmat container

item.title: Report E-2023060729
item.description:
Report E-2023060729

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 9, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted surface. MEG identified the damaged drum, patched the drum, and secured it in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. MEG deployed absorbents to the released material and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids. All waste generated was contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum and overpack were labeled and staged onsite for R+L personnel to process.

item.title: Report E-2023060721
item.description:
Report E-2023060721

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NBM experienced a release of UN2586 Prime Pak First Wave from (2) 5-gallon poly pails due to a load shift and forklift punctures. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 7-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor and 1' x 3' area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture and load shift. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were collected into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
